resources.string: Not yet supported for polar or parametric coordinates.
Warning: Must enter 2 functions for Number
X Min must be less than X Max.
Y Min must be less than Y Max.
One or more inputs is invalid.
This must be a function of the variable you wish to differentiate with respect to.
Sorry, center expression is not valid:
Start of outer bounds not valid:
End of outer bounds not valid:
Start of inner bounds not valid:
End of inner bounds not valid:

Sine: sin()
Cosine: cos()
Tangent: tan()
Secant: sec()
Cosecant: csc()
Cotangent: cot()
Inverse Sine: arcsin()
Inverse Cosine: arccos()
Inverse Tangent: arctan()
Inverse Secant: arcsec()
Inverse Cosecant: arccsc()
Inverse Cotangent: arccot()
Natural Log: ln()
Log Base 2: log2()
Log Base 10: log10()
Square Root: sqrt()
Exponents: ^ or **
Multiplication: *
Hyperbolic Sine: sinh()
Hyperbolic Cosine: cosh()
Hyperbolic Tangent: tanh()
Hyperbolic Secant: sech()
Hyperbolic Cosecant: csch()
Hyperbolic Cotangent: coth()
Inverse Hyperbolic Sine: arcsinh()
Inverse Hyperbolic Cosine: arccosh()
Inverse Hyperbolic Tangent: arctanh()
Inverse Hyperbolic Secant: arcsech()
Inverse Hyperbolic Cosecant: arccsch()
Inverse Hyperbolic Cotangent: arccoth()
Absolute Value: abs()
Sign Function: sign()
And: &, and
Or: |, or
Not: ~, not
Piece-wise functions (conditional)?(function):(conditional)?(function)

The graph has modes for standard, polar and parametric functions. Standard and polar use x as the independent variable (since there is no theta on your keyboard), and parametric equations use t. The 3D graph, slope field and diffy q solver use x and y. The functions will turn green if they are valid and red if they are not. Currently, only standard functions support the trace and dy/dx feature. Bounds for the polar and parametric functions can be found in window settings.

The derivative must be a function of the variable(s) you specify. For partial derivatives, enter multiple, comma-seperated variables in the f(__) field. The function will turn green when valid. If it is red, you may click Derive to be told of any errors. The derivative may appear to be quite messy for higher orders or complicated functions, but it is always correct.

Integration and arc length on newer phones should be nearly instantaneous. On older phones there may be a slight lag. For double integration and surface area, there may be some lag on newer phones and significant lag on older. The tool uses the Romberg method for numerical integration which is the extremely efficient, but you are still using a phone. If there is discontinuity over the interval, the program may not recognize it and return a blatantly invalid input.

If you have any suggestions, complaints or praise please forward them to me at jungajuice@gmail.com

Thank you very much to Professor Eck of Hobart and William Smith College for providing some very useful code for handling functions and derivatives. He provided the basis for which this application is possible.

Also, a big thanks to Jonathan Thomson for designing a new icon for this application.

Dedicated to Leah
Find the tangent line to the function
If you would like to see this application in your native language, please visit http://crowdin.net/project/calculus-tools and help with the translations.

Extra functions:

abs or norm(Matrix): square root of sum of squares
unit(Matrix): unit matrix
det(Matrix): determinant of a matrix
inv(Matrix): inverse of a matrix
eval(Matrix): eigenvalues
evec(Matrix): eigenvectors
solve(Matrix A,Matrix B): Solves Ax=B
fint(Function, Variable, Number, Number): Integration
fint(Function, Variable, Variable, Number, Number, Function, Function): Integration of a function of 2 variables

I have added a calculator function that supports matrix computations. Some things may still be broken at this point. The additional functions are listed above and are only available in the calculator. You may also use ans to use the previous answers. If the output is a matrix it may be stored by opening the menu. When entering matrices, place each row on a separate line and use commas to separate the rows. Spaces are ignored. Much more to come for this feature soon.
Limited capabilities: Unable to parse expression:

The old math keyboard is still bundled with this application. While it cannot be used in this application, it may be used elsewhere. In order to activate it, go to Settings >> Language and Keyboard on your phone and check the box next to Calculus Tools. In order to use the keyboard, long press on a text window, select Input method and then Calculus Tools. You may use this same process to switch back to your normal keyboard as well.
